content: Hi @Joshua Procious , I've been cleaning up my ballot worksheet and think I'm done except for a couple commenters that don't appear to have Jira accounts. Hoping you can help add them or give me next steps for that. I've private messaged you their names/emails. Thanks!
I'm helping the Pharmacy WG get comments into Jira for the CARIN RTPBC FHIR IG (2020-Feb - RX BENEFITCHECK R1 STU)
Hello Frank, I'm looking into finding those users now. I'll respond in PM for more details. Thanks for your patience.

@Joshua Procious I received a java error when submitting--and no corrections email was sent out. But ~20 of the comments were uploaded to Jira.
I think the issue was caused by values in the Section column (D) in the ballot spreadsheet, based on where the process appears to have stopped.
Should I fix and re-upload the whole ballot spreadsheet, or remove the records that got uploaded first, and just upload the remaining ones?
What specific Java error did you encounter?
@Lloyd McKenzie what do you recommend as far as fix and reupload all or remove the successful?

The text in the error wasn't selectable... so I screenshot-ed as much as I could (attached)
upload-error.png
@Frank McKinney Can you send me your spreadsheet?

@Lloyd McKenzie Just sent in email. Thanks.

I just re-sent... I realized I had removed the cell contents that I thought might have caused the error. I just sent you the spreadsheet with those values back in place
